EmailTemplate.subject: Lessons In Latency From E-Commerce
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
<http://vmturbo.com/solutions/use-cases/maintain-web-application-performance-demand-peaks?utm_source=vmturbo&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=ecommerce2015&utm_content=06102015> {{lead.First Name:default=edit me}},
78% of the United States shops online. No surprises there right? But did you know that an online shopper is 40% more likely to leave a site for another if page load time is greater than 2 seconds? Think about a busy shopping day like Black Friday, those lost customers quickly turn into lost revenue.
The latency that creates these delays online is the same latency that drives performance issues in data centers all around the globe. So what can we learn from these e-commerce companies combating latency?
Find out in our latest white paper; Empowering e-Commerce Against Unpredictable Demand. <http://vmturbo.com/solutions/use-cases/maintain-web-application-performance-demand-peaks?utm_source=vmturbo&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=vhm_love&utm_content=ecommerce>
After reading this white paper you’ll know:
- Common challenges facing data centers around the globe and website managers preparing for unpredictable spikes in demand. - Managing the tradeoffs between application, compute and storage resources, as well as network latency, across the virtual or cloud environment. - VMTurbo’s unique approach to addressing Quality of Service adherence, assuring application performance and providing users with peace of mind.
- The VMTurbo Team <http://vmturbo.com/solutions/use-cases/maintain-web-application-performance-demand-peaks?utm_source=vmturbo&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=vhm_love&utm_content=ecommerce>
